creditline: Gift of Diana Lee and Don Lucker
description: tops of four houses--three with red chimneys--visible over the crest of a hill; stylized grasses in foreground and trees in background; sky has pale pinkish-red and yellow bands at top
image_copyright: © Charles Burchfield Archive %2F Burchfield Penney Art Center
medium: Watercolor, gouache and graphite on paper
provenance: [Frank K.M. Rehn Gallery, New York]. Harold J. Goldman, Bellaire, Texas (by 1970). Sale, Sotheby's, New York, November 30, 1989, no. 262, bought in. [Sid Deutsch Gallery, New York]. [Owings-Dewey Fine Art, Santa Fe, New Mexico]; Don and Diana Lucker, Chanhassan, Minn. (until 2012; given to MIA)
text:
Charles Burchfield described this scene in a letter dated May 3, 1963:
“A sunny morning at the season when plant life is in its first lush growth – little houses ‘peek’ out at the beholder from behind a meadow of fresh young oats (The edge of Salem, Ohio).”
title: Morning in Late May
